message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: public class Calculator {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.println("Please enter your calculation:");
        String input = scanner.nextLine();
        
        StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(input, "+-*/", true);
        int n1 = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
        String operator = st.nextToken();
        int n2 = Integer.parseInt(st.nextToken());
        
        int result = 0;
        switch (operator) {
            case "+":
                result = n1 + n2;
                break;
            case "-":
                result = n1 - n2;
                break;
            case "*":
                result = n1 * n2;
                break;
            case "/":
                result = n1 / n2;
                break;
            default:
                System.out.println("Invalid operator");
                break;
        }
        
        System.out.println("Result: " + result);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The code above takes user input for a calculation in the format "number operator number" (e.g. "12 + 12") and uses StringTokenizer to separate the input into the two numbers and the operator. It then performs the calculation based on the operator and prints the result.
